meanings.definition: To pronounce with a nasal sound.
meanings.sent1: She was nasalising her words due to a cold.
meanings.sent2: He always ends up nasalising when he speaks too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The robot started nasalising its speech, causing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to be nasalising the air around us, creating a unique atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's impression of a nasalising cartoon character was spot-on.

meanings.definition: To make nasal; convert into a nasal sound.
meanings.sent1: The singer was nasalising her voice for the song's special effect.
meanings.sent2: The cold made him nasalise his voice unintentionally.
meanings.sent3: The machine malfunctioned, nasalising all the recorded messages.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to nasalise the howling of the wolves in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The old radio was nasalising the music, giving it a nostalgic feel.

meanings.sent1: The linguist was nasalising the pronunciation guide for the students.
meanings.sent2: The software can nasalise the audio to mimic different accents.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally nasalised the recipe instructions, leading to confusion.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to nasalise the colors on the canvas, creating a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell nasalised the appearance of the rabbit, making it look comical.
